articles.content: When we started building Nativly, we didnâ€™t set out to â€œadd translation.â€ We were trying to solve something more fundamental: Why should language decide who gets to participate in an online community? Most community platforms assume English. If you donâ€™t speak it comfortably, you adapt â€” or you leave. We didnâ€™t want adaptation. We wanted inclusion by default. This is the story of how we built a real-time multilingual community platform using: Next.js Supabase Lingo.dev SDK And how we made transl

articles.title: Study shows how rocket launches pollute the atmosphere
articles.description: Is the global atmospheric commons destined to be an industrial waste dumping ground?
articles.content: New research published Thursday bolsters growing concerns that a handful of companies and countries are using the global atmospheric commons as a dumping ground for potentially toxic and climate-altering industrial waste byproducts from loosely regulated commercial space flights. The new study analyzed a plume of pollution trailing part of a Falcon rocket that crashed through the upper atmosphere on Feb. 19, 2025, after SpaceX lost control of its reentry. The rocket was launched earlier that mon
articles.author: Bob Berwyn, Inside Climate News

articles.content: The team behind the beloved Dark Sky weather app has announced a new iPhone app called Acme Weather. The release comes after Apple's 2020 acquisition of Dark Sky , which it ultimately shut down in 2022 after integrating much of its tech into the native iOS Weather app. Acme Weather is primarily designed to address the uncertainty inherent in most forecasts, as different models yield disparate results and no two weather apps seem to report the same thing. articles.content: Mafia: The Old Country demands to be played on an enormous screen. As much as I love my 32-inch Alienware OLED gaming monitor, it doesn't do justice to Mafia's cinematic vistas of Sicily. But , I also wanted to play that game in its full 4K glory, with none of the compromises of today's game consoles. So why not just shove a tiny gaming desktop under my home theater?
